content.rendered:
August 2024

Message

cover story

UPDATES

in focus 1

in focus 2

in focus 3

civic driven change

partnerships

in the news

Partnerships

Aditya Birla Capital Foundation

The collaboration between Aditya Birla Capital Foundation and Smile Foundation to initiate 4 Mobile Health Units was flagged off in Delhi. The MHUs will provide healthcare services to underserved communities in Agra, Bhopal, Madurai, and Warangal.

Bajaj Finance Limited

25 Skilling Centers will be supported under Smile Foundation’s STeP programme, in partnership with Bajaj Finance Limited. Located in Pune, Kolkata, and Delhi, the centers are expected to train 4500 youth in Health, Retail, and Core Employability.

Bosch Foundation

Bosch Foundation is supporting three Smile on Wheels mobile health units, with telemedicine as a technology intervention for specialty consultation. The project is implemented in Nasik, Chennai, and Jaipur, and will provide over 1,35,000 treatments.

Commonwealth Bank of Australia

CBA is supporting Smile Foundation’s women empowerment programme Swabhiman in Bengaluru, Karnataka. The project will focus on women’s Reproductive and Child Health and Entrepreneurship Development.

Deutsche Bank

The 2nd phase of the Deutsche Bank Engineering Scholarship for Girls was launched in 4 cities, namely Mumbai, Pune, Jaipur, and Bengaluru. 100 girls were selected through a merit-based screening process to benefit from the scholarship.

Datamatics Business Solutions

A STeP Skilling Center has been supported by Datamatics Business Solutions. This center is more than just a learning facility; it’s a pathway to new opportunities for Mumbai’s youth, symbolizing a brighter, more inclusive future.

Grant Thornton Bharat LLP

Grant Thornton has collaborated with Smile Foundation in Gurugram, to improve children’s learning outcomes, focusing on foundational learning and STEM Education. They are also supporting a Skill Training center for marginalized youth in Delhi.

Healthium Medtech Ltd & Quality Needles Pvt Ltd

Healthium & QNPL are supporting two Smile on Wheels mobile health units in Chitrakoot, Uttar Pradesh, and Ramanathapuram, Tamil Nadu to bring primary healthcare services directly to the doorsteps of urban slums and rural villages.

NCR Corporation

NCR Corporation supported the upgradation of five primary health centers through a comprehensive approach aimed at improving various aspects of these facilities to provide better healthcare in villages of Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu.

Shell India

Shell India has partnered with Smile Foundation to reach out to 35,000 children in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Kerala. The children will undergo workshops for 3 SDGs—Food, Water, and Energy—and will demonstrate their local problem-solving solutions.
